pageContext.claim: “I think the best thing that’s happened to this country is the fact that, at least for three years, the fact that I have a very good relationship with Kim Jong Un. I think that’s a positive. His country has tremendous potential. He knows that. But our country has been playing around for 50 years and getting nothing. And we have a relationship. There’s never been a relationship with them.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has gotten no meaningful concessions from North Korea on denuclearization. Despite Trump taking the unprecedented step of meeting with dictator Kim Jong Un three times, handing him a propaganda victory and legitimizing him on the world stage, the state of play is the same as in previous administrations.
